meanings.sent1: The detective decided to criminate the suspect based on the evidence.
meanings.sent2: The prosecutor will criminate the defendant in court tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: It was easy to criminate the thief with the security camera footage.
meanings.sent4: Her fingerprints on the weapon would criminate her in the investigation.
meanings.sent5: The witness's testimony helped criminate the real culprit.

meanings.definition: To incriminate or implicate in wrongdoing
meanings.sent1: The leaked emails could criminate the company's CEO.
meanings.sent2: His suspicious behavior started to criminate him in the eyes of his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot accidentally started to criminate its owner during the family dinner.
meanings.sent4: The hidden camera footage would criminate anyone involved in the illegal activity.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious note found at the scene could criminate the mysterious figure lurking in the shadows.
